    • Constructor Detail

      • OfferFacade

        public OfferFacade(OfferDAO offerDAO,
                   OrderDAO orderDAO,
                   EmployeeDAO employeeDAO,
                   ApplicationMailer mailer,
                   TokenIssuer tokenIssuer,
                   TokenAuthenticator tokenAuthenticator)
        Creates a new OfferFacade.
        Parameters:
        offerDAO - The offer dao used to access the data storage in the application.
        orderDAO - The order dao used to validate the customers to issue offers to.
        employeeDAO - The employee dao used to validate the employees issuing offers.
        mailer - The object responsible for sending offer notification emails to customers.
        tokenIssuer - The object responsible for creating one-time tokens for the offer email sent to customers.
        tokenAuthenticator - The object responsible for authenticating one-time tokens for the offer email sent to customers.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public java.util.List<Offer> get(Constraints<OfferColumn> constraints)
        Returns the offers in the data storage. The results can be constrained using the provided constraints.
        Parameters:
        constraints - The constraints that modify the resulting list.
        Returns:
        The resulting offers.
        Throws:
        ApplicationException - When a data storage exception occurs while performing the operation.

      • get

        public java.util.List<Offer> get()
        Returns the offers in the data storage.
        Returns:
        The resulting offers.
        Throws:
        ApplicationException - When a data storage exception occurs while performing the operation.

      • get

        public java.util.List get(int order)
        Returns the offers issued to the order with the provided id.
        Parameters:
        order - The id of the order to return the related offers of.
        Returns:
        The offers related to the order with the provided id.
        Throws:
        ApplicationException - When a data storage exception occurs while performing the operation.

      • first

        public Offer first(Constraints<OfferColumn> constraints)
        Returns the first offer matching the provided constraints.
        Parameters:
        constraints - The constraints that modify the resulting list.
        Returns:
        The first offer matching the provided constraints. Returns null when no constraints matches the provided constraints.
        Throws:
        ApplicationException - When a data storage exception occurs while performing the operation.

      • create

        public Offer create(int orderId,
                    int employeeId,
                    int price)
             throws OfferValidatorException,
                    UnknownOrderException,
                    OrderNotActiveException,
                    InactiveCustomerException,
                    UnknownEmployeeException,
                    InactiveEmployeeException,
                    InsufficientPermissionsException
        Inserts a new offer into the data storage.
        Parameters:
        orderId - The id of the order the offer is issued for.
        employeeId - The id of the employee placing the offer.
        price - The total cost of the offer.
        Returns:
        The offer instance representing the newly created offer.
        Throws:
        ApplicationException - When a data storage exception occurs while performing the operation.
        OfferValidatorException - When the provided information is somehow invalid.
        UnknownOrderException - When the provided order id is unknown to the application.
        OrderNotActiveException - When the order is not active, and can therefor not be the subject of a new offer.
        InactiveCustomerException - When the provided customer is inactive, and can therefor not receive new offers.
        UnknownEmployeeException - When the provided employee id is unknown to the application.
        InactiveEmployeeException - When the provided employee is inactive, and can therefor not create new offers.
        InsufficientPermissionsException - When the provided employee does not have the permissions required to create new offers.

      • reject

        public void reject(int offerId)
            throws UnknownOfferException,
                   OfferNotOpenException
        Rejects the offer with the provided id.

        To accept an offer, use the PurchaseFacade.create(int) method, that will mark the provided offer accepted.

        Parameters:
        offerId - The id of the offer to mark reject.
        Throws:
        ApplicationException - When a data storage exception occurs while performing the operation.
        UnknownOfferException - When the provided offer id does not exist in the application.
        OfferNotOpenException - When the provided offer is not open, and can therefor not be rejected.

      • reject

        public void reject(int offer,
                   int tokenId,
                   java.lang.String tokenSecret)
            throws ExpiredTokenException,
                   IncorrectTokenException,
                   OfferNotOpenException,
                   UnknownOfferException
        Rejects the offer using the provided token.
        Parameters:
        offer - The if of the offer being rejected.
        tokenId - The token id to use when rejecting the offer.
        tokenSecret - The token secret to use when rejecting the offer.
        Throws:
        ApplicationException - When some data storage exception occurs.
        ExpiredTokenException - When the provided token has expired.
        IncorrectTokenException - When the provided token is invalid.
        OfferNotOpenException - When the offer is not in an open state, and can therefor not be rejected.
        UnknownOfferException - WHen the provided offer id is unknown to the application.

      • accept

        public Purchase accept(int offer,
                       int tokenId,
                       java.lang.String tokenSecret)
                throws ExpiredTokenException,
                       IncorrectTokenException,
                       InsufficientPermissionsException,
                       OfferNotOpenException,
                       UnknownOfferException,
                       InactiveCustomerException
        Accepts the offer using the provided token.
        Parameters:
        offer - The if of the offer being accepted.
        tokenId - The token id to use when accepting the offer.
        tokenSecret - The token secret to use when accepting the offer.
        Returns:
        The purchase record.
        Throws:
        ApplicationException - When some data storage exception occurs.
        ExpiredTokenException - When the provided token has expired.
        IncorrectTokenException - When the provided token is invalid.
        OfferNotOpenException - When the offer is not in an open state, and can therefor not be accepted.
        InsufficientPermissionsException - When the employee who created the offer is no longer a salesman.l
        UnknownOfferException - WHen the provided offer id is unknown to the application.
        InactiveCustomerException - When the customer accepting the offer, is not active.

      • getNumberOfOpenOffers

        public int getNumberOfOpenOffers(int customer)
        Returns the number of open offers for the provided customer.
        Parameters:
        customer - The customer to return the number of open offers for.
        Returns:
        The number of open offers for the provided customer.
        Throws:
        ApplicationException - When a data storage exception occurs while performing the operation.
